author: Melz✨
text: International Transgender Day of Visibility (TDOV) occurs every year on March 31st. This day is dedicated to celebrating transgender people, their contributions to society and raising awareness of discrimination faced by transgender people worldwide. #TDOV #TransDayOfVisibility https://t.co/eUWcDfVc8v

author: Melz✨
text:
Things to do today (Continued)

Better your understanding and empathy by watching a film or documentary that explores the lives of transgender people.

Disclosure (2020)
Transhood (2020)
The True Adventures of Wolfboy (2019) 

#TransIsBeautiful

author: Melz✨
text:
Things to do today

Learn about definitions and terms so that you may better familiarize yourself with queer and trans language. Tolerance comes from understanding. It requires effort and a willingness to accept change.

#TransRightsAreHumanRights

author: Melz✨
text:
#TransDayOfVisibility 
International Transgender Day

According to the human rights campaign, there are more than 2 million transgender people across the U.S.

According to the human rights campaign, 3 out of every 10 adults in the U.S personally know someone who is transgender.
